means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 劳斯绰号，红发人，来源于中世纪英语、古法语，含义是“红”(red)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"唤醒，醒来"之意。
means: rouse ： 较正式用词，用主动语态时，强调弄醒别人的努力，用被动语态时，指轻而易举地醒过来。可用于引申意义。
arouse ： 除表示一般的唤醒外，多作引申用。
awake ： 正式用词，常指觉醒、警惕的状态，也多用于比喻。
wake ： 普通常用词，指真正的醒来。即可作及物动词也可作不及物动词。
waken ： 书面用词，常用于被动态和引申意义。

sentence.Network_en: She seemed to be unable to rouse herself to do anything.
sentence.Network_cn: 她似乎打不起精神去做任何事情。

sentence.Network_en: He did more to rouse the crowd there than anybody else.
sentence.Network_cn: 他比其他任何人都更积极地鼓动那里的群众。

sentence.Network_en: The uproar was enough to rouse both the quick and the dead.
sentence.Network_cn: 这喧嚣声足以惊醒生者和死者.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (originally as a hawking and hunting term): probably from Anglo-Norman French, of unknown ultimate origin

entry.def: If someone rouses you when you are sleeping or if you rouse, you wake up.

example.ex: Hilton roused him at eight-thirty by rapping on the door...
example.tran: 希尔顿8点半敲门把他叫醒了。

example.ex: When I put my hand on his, he stirs but doesn't quite rouse.
example.tran: 当我把手放到他手上时，他动了动，但并没有完全醒来。

entry.tran: 使自己活跃起来;让自己振作
entry.def: If you rouse yourself, you stop being inactive and start doing something.

example.ex: She seemed to be unable to rouse herself to do anything...
example.tran: 她似乎打不起精神去做任何事情。

example.ex: He roused himself from his lazy contemplation of the scene beneath him...
example.tran: 他不再懒洋洋地注视着下面的景色。

entry.tran: 使激动;鼓动;煽动;使振奋
entry.def: If something or someone rouses you, they make you very emotional or excited.

example.ex: He did more to rouse the crowd there than anybody else...
example.tran: 他比其他任何人都更积极地鼓动那里的群众。

example.ex: Ben says his father was good-natured, a man not quickly roused to anger or harsh opinions.
example.tran: 本说他父亲的脾气温和，不轻易发火或是发表尖锐的意见。

entry.def: If something rouses a feeling in you, it causes you to have that feeling.

example.ex: It roused a feeling of rebellion in him...
This roused my interest in politics and I went to work for the Democrats.
example.tran: 这激发了我对政治的兴趣，于是我开始效力于民主党。

sentences.sentence: "The police routed them out of bed at 2 A.M."

means.word_mean: 3. cause to be agitated, excited, or roused;

sentences.sentence: "The speaker charged up the crowd with his inflammatory remarks"

means.word_mean: 4. cause to become awake or conscious;

sentences.en: I usually rouse at six in the morning.
sentences.cn: 我通常在早晨6点钟醒来。

sentences.en: It's time to rouse the children.
Their rejection of these measures roused the people to indignation.
sentences.cn: 他们拒不采取这些措施, 引起了人民的愤慨。

jushi.english: I laughed and dozed, then roused and read again.
jushi.chinese: 我笑了一阵,小睡了一会儿,然后醒来,又看起了书。

jushi.english: I roused at the six in the morning.
jushi.chinese: 我通常在早晨六点钟醒来。

jushi.english: The dog roused a deer from the bushes.
jushi.chinese: 这只狗惊起了丛林中的一只鹿。
